revised_title: The Role of the Pituitary Gland in Frog Color Changes
tldr: This study investigates the effect of the pituitary gland on color changes in frogs. The researchers found that removing the pituitary gland caused the frogs to remain pale with contracted melanophores and expanded xantholeucophores. This suggests that the pituitary gland plays a direct role in controlling pigmentary response in frogs.
